known_for: Oldest licensed shop in the district. The proprietor's family has held the license for four generations.
notes: The round window is said to be the original model for all archive shop windows.

known_for: Family tree authentication, expedition contracts, licensing disputes.
notes: Run by the scholar Pella Valdun herself. Direct Senate access.

known_for: Maps of all regions, especially Yeller Quarry routes.
notes: Founded by Senna Grell. Now run by her apprentices after her death.

known_for: Expedition reports, creature sketches, taxonomic treatises.
notes: Best source for Yeller Quarry creature documentation.

known_for: Manuscripts of disputed provenance, items too sensitive for licensed shops.
notes: No formal license. Tolerated by authorities for reasons unknown. Round window painted black.

known_for: Official overflow storage for Senate documents.
notes: Government-subsidized. Prices fixed by law.

known_for: Specializes in materials from Mirado. Water-school philosophical texts.
notes: Only shop with regular trade connections to the tower city.

known_for: Materials from northern expeditions, village records.
notes: Dusty and disorganized, but occasionally yields treasures.

known_for: Stone-school philosophical texts. Controversial reputation.
notes: Founded by the scholar Oben Marsh. Some suspect forgeries among the holdings.

known_for: Successor to The Cartographer's Hole. Modern mapping techniques.
notes: Run by Gareth Poll, trained by Vagabu himself.

known_for: Comprehensive expedition documentation. All major surveys represented.
notes: Best organized collection of field reports in the district.

known_for: Poetry manuscripts, song collections, lyrical philosophy.
notes: Far from Senate, catering to literary rather than official clientele.

known_for: Yeller Quarry lineage documentation, family tree authentication.
notes: Essential for anyone planning Quarry expeditions requiring guide credentials.

known_for: General collection. Nothing exceptional, but reliable.
notes: The minor archivist waits at his window. Serviceable for common needs.

known_for: Definitive collection of water-school texts. Anti-stone-school materials.
notes: Founded by Nessa Bright. Explicitly refuses to stock stone-school works.

known_for: Political history, Senate records, conquest documentation.
notes: Founded by the scholar Donal Crest. Strong on Dens conquest materials.

known_for: Unsorted manuscripts purchased in bulk from estates. Treasures among trash.
notes: Furthest from Senate. No formal organization. Bring patience.

known_for: Creature materials with stone-school interpretive framework.
notes: Run by Jara Torval. Unique perspective on creature naming.

known_for: Specializes in recorded arguments, cardhouse debates, scholarly disputes.
notes: Best source for kachot-game transcripts and debate records.

known_for: Pebble-school texts. Fibon's works and commentaries.
notes: Founded by Denna Vox. Small but dedicated collection.

known_for: Authentication services. Also sells materials of uncertain provenance.
notes: Officially a forgery detection service. Rumors suggest they create as well as detect.

known_for: Military expedition documentation. Siege of Mirado materials.
notes: Best source for Colonel Viragu's reports and correspondence.

known_for: Copying services and secondhand manuscripts.
notes: Primarily a copying shop. Secondhand materials of variable quality.

known_for: Literalist philosophical texts. Brother of the disappeared Callis Fenn.
notes: Remote location. Clientele tends toward the eccentric.

known_for: General reference. Close to Senate for quick consultations.
notes: Convenient location. Adequate but unremarkable collection.
